DOC.HEAD: China Denies Giving Sanctuary to Ceausescu
With AM-Romania
DOC.TEXT: China on Saturday denied giving sanctuary to ousted Romanian President Nicolae Ceausescu. ``The notion that Ceausescu has fled to China is utterly groundless,'' the Foreign Ministry said in a statement. The 71-year-old Ceausescu was variously reported to have fled Bucharest after being overthrown Friday, but his whereabouts remain unknown. Beijing has long been a staunch supporter of Ceausescu's hard-line government, and there was speculation he might seek refuge in China. Ceausescu backed China's bloody suppression of the student-led pro-democracy movement last spring, and China's Communist Party chief Jiang Zemin spoke recently of the ``sincere and profound'' friendship between the two countries. The Foreign Ministry declined comment on Ceausescu's demise, and there were no reports of events in Romania in either the official Xinhua News Agency or the Communist Party's People's Daily. Ceausescu has visited China at least six times during his 24-year reign. His last official trip was in October 1988.
